title: Free-body diagrams-block on ramp after string cut

content.question: The left figure shows a block at rest on a rough inclined surface. The block is attached to a wall by a string of negligible mass. The vector sum of the forces is zero. The right figure shows the free-body diagram for the block. The string is cut and the vector sum of the forces on the block remains zero. Which of the following free-body diagrams could show the forces exerted on the block after the string is cut?

choices.label: The figure shows a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a dot on a gridded plane. The first arrow extends upward and to the left until it ends one unit to the left, and one unit above the dot. The second arrow extends upward and to the right until its ends at a point that is 2 units to the right, and 2 units above the dot. The third arrow extends vertically downward until it ends at a point 4 units below the dot.
